item.title: 英伟达和其他大型企业股涨势不减，期货走高
item.description: 周三，随着权重最大的股票在盘前交易中上涨，S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数期货也随之上涨，而市场则在等待美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的评论以及本周晚些时候的重要事件，以寻找更多方向。【原文：Futures for the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq gained on Wednesday as the most heavily weighted stocks rose in premarket trading, while markets awaited comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and key events later in the week for more direction.】

item.title: 投资者押注政府支出，太空初创企业融资持续复苏
item.description: 英国投资公司 Seraphim Space 的数据显示，4 月至 6 月，太空初创企业吸引了 24.1 亿美元的全球投资，连续第三个季度实现融资增长。【原文：Space startups attracted $2.41 billion in global investments from April to June, marking a third consecutive quarter of growth in funding, according to British investment firm Seraphim Space.】

item.title: 早间竞价：中国避开通货紧缩，新西兰放鸽子，市场趋于平静
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 夏日炎炎，美国零售商试图将返校购物时间推迟到七月
item.description: 尽管美国儿童可能希望暑假永远不要结束，但零售商却希望返校季比以往任何时候都更早开始--最好是现在--并在亚马逊的 Prime Day 之前确定促销时间。【原文：While American children may wish summer vacation would never end, retailers want back-to-school season to start earlier than ever -- preferably now -- and are timing promotions ahead of Amazon's Prime Day.】

item.title: 聚焦：全球锂行业关注阿根廷盐滩的技术试运行
item.description: 在阿根廷北部山区的一个尘土飞扬的平原上，两层楼高的黑色管道将从地下深处吸来的盐水注入一个巨大的罐中。【原文：In a dusty plain in northern Argentina's mountains, black tubes stretching two stories high fill a massive tank with salty brine sucked from deep below ground.】

item.title: 独家报道分析发现，大多数患者在两年内停止使用 Wegovy 和 Ozempic 减肥药
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份美国药房索赔分析报告显示，两年后，只有四分之一的美国患者仍在服用诺和诺德的Wegovy或Ozempic减肥药。【原文：Only one in four U.S. patients prescribed Novo Nordisk’s Wegovy or Ozempic for weight loss were still taking the popular medications two years later, according to an analysis of U.S. pharmacy claims provided to Reuters that also showed a steady decline in use over time.】

item.title: 克莱斯勒因前座安全气囊故障召回 33.2 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，由于前座安全气囊存在潜在问题，可能无法按预期展开，克莱斯勒将在美国召回33.2万辆阿尔法-罗密欧、吉普和菲亚特汽车。【原文：Chrysler is recalling 332,000 Alfa Romeo, Jeep, and Fiat vehicles in the United States due to a potential issue with the front seat air bags, which may not deploy as intended, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 宝马因驾驶员安全气囊故障召回约 39.4 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，德国汽车制造商宝马公司将因驾驶员安全气囊故障在美国召回394029辆汽车。【原文：German carmaker BMW will recall 394,029 vehicles in the United States over faulty driver airbags, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 随着全球饮酒习惯的改变，烈酒将超越葡萄酒
item.description: 世界烈酒联盟（World Spirits Alliance）周三发布的一份报告预测，随着人们饮酒偏好的改变，伏特加和威士忌等烈酒的全球销量将超过葡萄酒。【原文：More cases of spirits such as vodka and whisky than of wine are set to be sold globally, a report from the World Spirits Alliance predicted on Wednesday, as drinking preferences have shifted.】

item.title: 由于消费下滑，中国第二季度 GDP 可能失去复苏动力：路透社民意调查
item.description: 由于消费需求低迷，中国第二季度经济可能同比增长5.1%，与前三个月的强劲开局相比有所放缓，这使人们继续预期中国政府将需要采取更多刺激措施。【原文：China's economy likely grew 5.1% in the second quarter from a year earlier, slowing from a strong start in the first three months due to sluggish consumer demand, keeping alive expectations Beijing will need to unleash more stimulus.】

item.title: 独家报道中国加强对四大审计公司的审查
item.description: 三位知情人士称，中国财政部正在对四大审计公司为本地公司所做的工作进行更严格的检查，因为人们担心审计师在揭露企业不法行为方面做得不够。【原文：China's Ministry of Finance is conducting more rigorous checks of work done by the Big Four auditing firms for local companies, three people with knowledge of the matter said, amid concerns auditors are not doing enough to uncover corporate wrongdoing.】

item.title: 论文称：为保护股票价值，需要采取积极的气候行动
item.description: 智囊机构EDHEC-风险气候影响组织在周三发表的一份长达74页的文件中警告说，决策者如果想避免全球股票价值损失高达50%，就应该采取积极的政策来控制气候变化。【原文：Decision makers should pursue aggressive policies to bring climate change under control if they want to avoid losses in the value of global stocks that could top 50%, think-tank EDHEC-Risk Climate Impact warned in a 74-page paper published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 惠誉分析师称日本信用状况将受益于利率上升
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）的日本主权分析师告诉路透社记者，尽管公共财政面临更大压力，但日本的物价上涨和利率上调可能会使债务膨胀并提高生产率，从而有利于该国的信用状况。【原文：Japan's price increases and higher interest rates could benefit the country's credit profile by inflating debt away and promoting productivity despite higher pressure on public finances, Fitch Ratings' Japan sovereign analyst told Reuters.】

item.title: 电动汽车需求下滑影响奔驰第二季度销量
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）汽车制造商周三表示，由于对电池电动汽车的需求下滑，该公司第二季度的销量下降了 6%。【原文：Mercedes-Benz saw a 6% decline in sales in the second quarter as demand for battery-electric vehicles slumped, the carmaker said on Wednesday, promising to make up lost ground with improved availability and market launches.】

item.title: 宝马第二季度销量下降
item.description: 德国高档汽车制造商宝马周三称，其第二季度销量同比下降 1.3%，为 618,826 辆。【原文：German premium carmaker BMW on Wednesday said its second-quarter sales fell by 1.3% year-on-year to 618,826 vehicles.】

item.title: 在可能关闭布鲁塞尔工厂和发布盈利预警后，大众汽车股价下跌
item.description: 欧洲最大的汽车制造商大众汽车公司周二晚些时候发布盈利预警，原因是与奥迪布鲁塞尔工厂可能关闭有关的费用，大众汽车股价在法兰克福早盘交易中下跌 1.5%。【原文：Shares in Volkswagen fell 1.5% in early Frankfurt trade after Europe's biggest carmaker late on Tuesday issued a profit warning due to charges related to the possible closure of Audi's Brussels plant.】

item.title: 在新的关税担忧下，中国 6 月出口增长更快：路透社民意调查
item.description: 6 月份，中国出口可能创下 15 个月以来的最快增速，原因是制造商预期越来越多的中国主要出口市场将加征关税，因此提前发货。【原文：China's exports likely grew at the fastest pace in fifteen months in June, as manufacturers front-load shipments in anticipation of tariffs from a growing number of the country's major export markets.】

item.title: 台积电第二季度营收受人工智能提振大幅增长，远超市场预期
item.description: 全球最大的合约芯片制造商台积电周三公布，由于人工智能（AI）应用需求旺盛，该公司第二季度收入增长强劲，大幅超出市场预期。【原文：TSMC , the world's largest contract chipmaker, reported strong growth in second-quarter revenue on Wednesday that handily beat market forecasts, on the back of booming demand for artificial intelligence (AI) applications.】

item.title: 彭博社称横滨橡胶正在洽谈以至少 10 亿美元收购固特异的越野轮胎业务
item.description: 据彭博社周三报道，日本横滨橡胶公司（Yokohama Rubber）正在洽谈以至少 10 亿美元的价格收购固特异轮胎橡胶公司（Goodyear Tire & Rubber）的越野轮胎业务。【原文：Japan's Yokohama Rubber is in talks to buy Goodyear Tire & Rubber's off-road tyre business for at least $1 billion, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 微软在监管审查中放弃 OpenAI 董事会观察员席位
item.description: 微软已经放弃了在 OpenAI 董事会的观察员席位，该席位曾引起大西洋两岸监管机构的审查，微软表示，在过去八个月中，这家人工智能初创公司的治理已得到显著改善，因此没有必要再保留该席位。【原文：Microsoft has ditched the board observer seat at OpenAI that has drawn regulatory scrutiny on both sides of the Atlantic, saying it was not necessary after the AI start-up's governance had improved significantly in the past eight months.】

item.title: 在投资者等待收益和大选之际，降息前景可能提振美股
item.description: 近期降息的前景支持投资者继续看涨美国股市，而在此之前，即将公布的企业财报和日益加剧的政治不确定性可能很快会对美国股市构成考验。【原文：The prospect of near-term interest rate cuts is bolstering the case for investors to remain bullish after a run in U.S. stocks that may soon be tested by upcoming corporate earnings reports and growing political uncertainty.】

item.title: 欧洲 通货膨胀斗争出现转机
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 消息人士称，日本央行将下调经济增长预期，预计通胀率将保持在目标附近
item.description: 消息人士称，日本央行可能会在 7 月份下调今年的经济增长预期，但预计未来几年的通胀率将保持在 2% 的目标附近，从而保持了本月加息的可能性。【原文：The Bank of Japan will likely trim this year's economic growth forecast in July but project inflation will stay around its 2% target in coming years, sources said, keeping alive the chance of an interest rate hike this month.】

item.title: 新西兰中央银行维持现金利率不变，预示未来可能放宽政策
item.description: 新西兰中央银行周三将现金利率稳定在5.5%的水平上，但如果通胀率如预期般放缓，该行将敞开大门，逐步放宽货币政策的限制。【原文：New Zealand's central bank held the cash rate steady at 5.5% on Wednesday, but opened the door to monetary policy becoming less restrictive over time should inflation slow as expected.】

item.title: 亚洲股市下跌；新西兰央行会议前新西兰元走强
item.description: 亚洲股市周三小幅走低，此前美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对美国今年晚些时候降息的预期时间没有给出什么暗示，尽管他表示对通胀即将回落有更大的信心。【原文：Asian stocks edged marginally lower on Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell offered little hints on the timing of U.S. rate cuts expected later this year, even as he signalled greater confidence that inflation was coming to heel.】

item.title: 需求疲软，中国 6 月消费通胀不及预期
item.description: 6 月份，中国居民消费价格连续第五个月增长，但低于预期，而生产者价格通货紧缩依然存在，政府的支持措施使世界第二大经济体的复苏步履维艰。【原文：China's consumer prices grew for a fifth month in June but missed expectations, while producer price deflation persisted, as government support measures set a bumpy recovery in motion for the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 受 KKR 股份出售报告影响，国际电气股价下跌 9
item.description: 在路透社报道私募股权公司 KKR 计划减持这家日本芯片设备制造商的股份后一天，国际电气的股价在周三东京早盘交易中下跌了 9%。【原文：Shares in Kokusai Electric fell 9% in early Tokyo trading on Wednesday, a day after Reuters reported private equity firm KKR plans to cut its stake in the Japanese chip equipment manufacturer.】

item.title: 美元因鲍威尔的谨慎而坚挺，奇异果在利率决定前等待时机
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对何时降息持谨慎态度后，美元在周三从三周低点反弹。【原文：The dollar was on the front foot on Wednesday having rebounded from a three-week low after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell struck a cautious tone on how soon interest rate cuts would come.】

item.title: 美国库存下降，降息前景光明，石油反弹
item.description: 行业报告显示上周美国原油和燃料库存下降，表明需求稳定，而且降息前景改善，油价在连续三天下跌后于周三反弹。【原文：Oil prices rebounded on Wednesday following three days of declines after an industry report showed U.S. crude and fuel stockpiles fell last week, indicating steady demand, and the outlook for interest rate cuts improved.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国平安正考虑发行最高 50 亿美元的可转换债券
item.description: 据两位直接知情人士透露，中国平安保险正在考虑发行价值高达 50 亿美元的可转换债券。【原文：China's Ping An Insurance is considering issuing a convertible bond worth up to $5 billion, according to two sources with direct knowledge of the matter.】
